meanings.sent1: The solar panel produced only a few nanowatts of electricity.
meanings.sent2: Scientists measure the power of tiny devices in nanowatts.
meanings.sent3: The flashlight was so dim, it probably only emitted a couple of nanowatts.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was barely a whisper, just a nanowatt of sound in the noisy room.
meanings.sent5: The tiny LED bulb glowed with the power of a nanowatt, barely visible in the dark.

meanings.definition: A unit of power equal to one billionth of a watt.
meanings.sent1: The electronic device consumed only a fraction of a nanowatt to operate.
meanings.sent2: The nanowatt measurement was crucial in determining the efficiency of the circuit.
meanings.sent3: The battery drained so slowly, it seemed to be using nanowatts of energy.
meanings.sent4: In the vast ocean of power, his contribution was merely a nanowatt.
meanings.sent5: The spaceship's engines roared to life, fueled by the power of nanowatts, propelling it into space.
